page.title: 04PICKERING NOOK/BYERMOOR
page.content: Byermoor is a small settlement on the A692 east of Burnopfield.There is a Catholic Church and school and one estate of houses.The names of the streets are closely linked to the area Gibside crescent and Bowes Crescent are both obviously named after the Bowes family and the estate they owned in the Derwent Valley north of Burnopfield. Pickering Nook and Hobson are one settlement almost.According to the 1981 Census there were{222 residents } and{101 households.}The school has closed and is now a craft centre while the Methodist Chapel has been taken over by a local builder's merchant.There is a public golf course run by Derwentside District Council. There are no shops,one public house,a petrol station and a garage selling and repairing cars.
